The neighborhood, Mott Haven, a waterfront enclavewith a mix of industrial and residential properties, is no longerdefined by old stereotypes. It is undergoing a gradual reinvention,with restaurants opening, scruffy buildings getting spiffed up andapartments being built on gap-toothed lots. Plans are in motion forhundreds of rental units along a stretch of the Harlem River whereJordan L. Mott, for whom the area was named, once made iron stovesand other items. The 4, 5, 6 and 2 trains all serve theneighborhood, some part time. Some commuters in the BrucknerBoulevard area take the 6 train from Third Avenue-138th Street,then transfer to either the 4 or 5 express train at 125th Street,arriving in Midtown in 20 minutes. The closest Metro-North Railroadstops are Harlem 125th Street and Yankees East 153rdStreet.

Hanley New York is located in the heart of Manhattans Upper East Side, one of the most desirable neighborhoods in New York City. With countless luxury boutiques, internationally renowned cultural institutions and the lush natural beauty of Central Park, the Upper East Side has long been one of Manhattans most elegant neighborhoods. Hanley New York is within several blocks of the 4, 5, 6, N, Q and R subway lines and is a pleasant walk from Midtown and the Plaza District. Inspired by the architecture of mid-century icons including Le Corbusier and Mies van der Rohe, and thoroughly updated for an effortlessly elevated 21st-century lifestyle, Hanley New York brings an unmistakably downtown edge to uptown living. The buildings original, namesake white glazed facade bricks  manufactured by Hanley Brick  are contrasted with new, black-glazed, subway-style bricks on accent walls throughout the ground level. Works of art by photographer Olaf Otto Becker and abstract painter Malcolm Hill are sophisticated complements to the Lobby by celebrated designers Enrico Bonetti and Shamir Shah. The amenities themselves are paired with white-glove services and tech-savvy features to offer residents every convenience along with a host of brilliantly contemporary luxuries. Hanley New Yorks original, elegantly proportioned floor plans have been renovated with finishes and features that speak to modern tastes. In addition to hardwood floors throughout and upgraded kitchens, all residences will offer the comfort of thermostat-controlled HVAC. Select residences feature expansive terraces and balconies with extraordinary views of the New York City skyline as well as washer/dryers. Modern design brilliance abounds in our well thought-out amenities. The concierge has ample storage for all of your deliveries including cold storage for groceries and flowers and hanging racks for laundry and dry cleaning in addition to shelving for standard packages that come for you. Our resident App alerts you in real time when your packages arrive and a digital message board in the mail room reminds you of your delivery upon arrival home. The Fitness Center, by Jay Wright of The Wright Fit, offers an innovative approach to health and wellness founded in the latest exercise science research. Overlooking the Courtyard, and designed with ample room to workout with your personal trainer, the Fitness Center is equipped with state-of-the-art exercise equipment including Woodway treadmills by 4Front and Cybex Arc Trainers. Inspired by the concept of an urban tree house, the expansive Resident Lounge has been designed with defined lounging and study areas as well as a childrens play space. If you need a little extra space the building has a storage room with individual lockers as well as a bike room. Pets are welcome and with our close proximity to Central Park they love our location in the heart of the Upper East Side.....YOU MUST CONTACT TERRY BATER TO SCHEDULE A PRIVATE  VIEWING TIME .........

Experience the definition of rustic elegance at The Spire Lofts, where contemporary brilliance meets ancient European charm. Live within the walls of one of North Williamsburgs oldest landmarks, the former St. Vincent De Paul Church that has been masterfully restored and converted into authentic loft apartments - with its extraordinary beauty intact. Here, modern details and state-of-the-art finishes blend flawlessly with expertly salvaged materials, including original exposed brick, reclaimed Heart Pine pillars and beams, arched stained glass windows, custom steel work and exceptional quirks around every corner.Sprawling layouts, some with soaring 20 foot ceiling heights, and matchless distinction create incredibly rare and unique living spaces not found in NYC today. Enter through the towering building entry and make your way down dramatic hallways, adorned with dark leather walls and inlaid wood floors made from 100-year-old shipping boxes. Inside each loft duplex you will find reclaimed wooden staircases leading to the mezzanine, with sliding wooden doors, catwalks made of distressed cast iron and stunning en suite bathrooms. The custom designed open kitchens contain Caesarstone countertops, impeccable penny tiled marble backslashes, Kingston Brass fixtures and boast a gourmet appliance package of top-of-the-line appliances with Bosch washer/dryers, Fisher-Paykel dish drawers and stainless steel Bloomberg appliances.Each residence, unique in its own right, contains bathrooms with reclaimed brick walls, pressed tin ceilings, steam showers and custom built vanities with imported stone. Over-sized, arched windows create bright, sun-drenched rooms throughout, and wide plank hardwood floors lend a loft-like feel to each spectacular room. The Spire Lofts is located around the corner from the L train at Bedford Avenue, only one stop outside Manhattan as well as countless bars, cafes and boutiques in one of NYCs most desirable areas. Enjoy seasonal, farm-to-table cuisine at Reynard, Five Leaves or Caf Colette any night of the week. Transport yourself back to the prohibition era in time for cocktail hour with oysters, infused gin and debonair bartenders at Hotel Delmano. Snag some one-of-a-kind vintage attire at Antoinette, catch a movie at the newly constructed Williamsburg Cinema or stroll over to 35-acre McCarren Park, which has dog runs, a public swimming pool, fields for soccer and baseball and a Green Market on weekends.
